channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: As the WNBA season tips off, here are 4 of our biggest questions
item.description: Will a new-look Indiana Fever contend in Caitlin Clark's second year? Will A'ja Wilson win a record 4th MVP? And the biggest question of all: Can the league as a whole build on last season's success?
item.content:encoded:
Will a new-look Indiana Fever contend in Caitlin Clark's second year? Will A'ja Wilson win a record 4th MVP? And the biggest question of all: Can the league as a whole build on last season's success?

(Image credit: Ethan Miller)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: SCOTUS divided over birthright citizenship. And, a recap of Diddy's trial
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court justices heard arguments over birthright citizenship yesterday. And, week one of Sean "Diddy" Combs' criminal trial featured testimony from witnesses and alleged victims.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Supreme Court justices heard arguments over birthright citizenship yesterday. And, week one of Sean "Diddy" Combs' criminal trial featured testimony from witnesses and alleged victims.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Scientists have figured out why flamingos are such weird eaters
item.description: Flamingos look silly when they eat, but new research suggests they're actually being smart.
item.content:encoded:
Flamingos look silly when they eat, but new research suggests they're actually being smart.

(Image credit: Serhat Cetinkaya)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Trump denounces 'activist' judges. He's not the first president to do so
item.description: Criticism of "activist" judges predates the term and has come from both ends of the political spectrum. Democratic and Republican presidents alike have accused the courts of exceeding their constitutional role.
item.content:encoded:
Criticism of "activist" judges predates the term and has come from both ends of the political spectrum. Democratic and Republican presidents alike have accused the courts of exceeding their constitutional role.

(Image credit: â€Ž)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: 2 officials fired by Trump return to court to challenge his power
item.description: Cathy Harris and Gwynne Wilcox, Democratic board members of independent agencies, argue that President Trump lacked the authority to fire them, citing federal law and Supreme Court precedent.
item.content:encoded: Cathy Harris and Gwynne Wilcox, Democratic board members of independent agencies, argue that President Trump lacked the authority to fire them, citing federal law and Supreme Court precedent.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: What Trump administration move puzzled scientists? Find out in the quiz
item.description: This week's quiz features real-life alchemy, nudity bans, expensive gifts, curriculum changes, and the new pope. Good luck!
item.content:encoded: This week's quiz features real-life alchemy, nudity bans, expensive gifts, curriculum changes, and the new pope. Good luck!
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Historical precedent: Courts wrestle with White House's 'invasion' claim
item.description: Federal judges are looking back to the 18th century to define what constitutes an invasion, weighing a key legal argument for the Trump administration's use of a wartime deportation authority.
item.content:encoded:
Federal judges are looking back to the 18th century to define what constitutes an invasion, weighing a key legal argument for the Trump administration's use of a wartime deportation authority.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Why UnitedHealth's terrible year is dragging down the Dow
item.description: The health care giant's shares are down more than 50% in the last month. That's hurting the powerful U.S. stock-market index.
item.content:encoded:
The health care giant's shares are down more than 50% in the last month. That's hurting the powerful U.S. stock-market index.

(Image credit: TIMOTHY A. CLARY/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: New to your queerness? Here's how to find a supportive community in your area
item.description: It can be intimidating to enter a new queer space, especially if you're starting to explore your gender and sexuality. Organizers share advice on how to find a support network with confidence.
item.content:encoded:
It can be intimidating to enter a new queer space, especially if you're starting to explore your gender and sexuality. Organizers share advice on how to find a support network with confidence.

(Image credit: Nickolai Hammar/ NPR)
item.dc:creator: Margaret Cirino

item.title: Why so many clinics that provide abortion are closing, even where it's still legal
item.description: New financial pressures on clinics that provide abortion are forcing some to close their doors, even in states that protect the right to abortion.
item.content:encoded:
New financial pressures on clinics that provide abortion are forcing some to close their doors, even in states that protect the right to abortion.

(Image credit: Bobby Anttila)
item.dc:creator: Kate Wells
